com.gmail.val59000mc.configuration

Class YamlFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bukkit.configuration.MemorySection
      • org.bukkit.configuration.MemoryConfiguration
        • org.bukkit.configuration.file.FileConfiguration
          • org.bukkit.configuration.file.YamlConfiguration
            • com.gmail.val59000mc.configuration.YamlFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.configuration.Configuration, org.bukkit.configuration.ConfigurationSection

    public class YamlFile
extends org.bukkit.configuration.file.YamlConfiguration
    An extension of YamlConfiguration which saves all data in Yaml to a configuration file. Note that this implementation is not synchronized.

    • Constructor Detail

      • YamlFile

        public YamlFile()
        Builds this FileConfiguration without any configuration file.

        In order to save changes you will have to use one of these methods before:
        - setConfigurationFile(File)
        - setConfigurationFile(String)
        Or set the file when saving changes with FileConfiguration.save(File)

      • YamlFile

        public YamlFile(java.lang.String path)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Builds this FileConfiguration with the file specified by path.
        Parameters:
        path - location for the configuration file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if path is null or is a directory.
        Note that if IllegalArgumentException is thrown then this configuration file will be null.

      • YamlFile

        Parameters:
        file - the configuration file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file is null or is a directory.
        Note that if IllegalArgumentException is thrown then this configuration file will be null.

    • Method Detail

      • save

        public void save()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves this FileConfiguration to the configuration file location.

        If the file does not exist, it will be created. If already exists, it will be overwritten. If it cannot be overwritten or created, an exception will be thrown.

        This method will save using the system default encoding, or possibly using UTF8.

        Note that this method will not copy the comments of original configuration file, use saveWithComments() instead.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if it hasn't been possible to save configuration file
        See Also:
        saveWithComments()

      • saveWithComments

        public void saveWithComments()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Saves this FileConfiguration to the configuration file location with comments.

        IMPORTANT: Use save() if configuration file has not comments or don't need it to improve time efficiency.

        This method will copy the comments from the configuration file if exists to the saved new file.
        Note that comments next to a value will not be copied, to be copied the comment must have character '#' as first character, ignoring indentations and blank spaces.

        If the file does not exist, it will be created. If already exists, it will be overwritten.

        This method will save using the system default encoding, or possibly using UTF8.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if it hasn't been possible to save configuration file
        See Also:
        save()

      • copyTo

        public java.io.File copyTo(java.lang.String path)
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Copy this configuration file to another path, without deleting configuration file. If there is already a file on the other path it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        path - the location of the new file, including name (mustn't be a directory)
        Returns:
        the new copied file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if configuration file is not found as source to copy
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if path is a directory or it is null
        java.io.IOException - if there I/O error occurs copying file

        Parameters:

        Throws:

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if path is a directory or it is null
        java.io.IOException - if there I/O error occurs copying file

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Tests whether this configuration file exists.
        Returns:
        true if and only if this configuration file exists; false otherwise

      • createNewFile

        public void createNewFile(boolean overwrite)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new empty file atomically for this configuration file.

        Furthermore there will be created the parent directories if there not exists.

        Parameters:
        overwrite - indicates if file must be overwritten if it already exists. Note that if overwrite is set to false and there is already a file with that path file will not be created and no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if I/O error occurs creating the configuration file

      • deleteFile

        public void deleteFile()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes this configuration file from disk.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file cannot be deleted
